Job Description and Requirements:
This is an exciting opportunity to join the Center of Customer Excellence team as a Frontend Application Engineer (AE).
Drive successful business engagements, competitive situations, customer tapeouts and collaborations to showcase and deploy Synopsys' latest technologies.
Drive R&D product roadmaps and improvements.
Present product updates and lead discussions in areas of expertise.
The job involves working closely with users/customers and multiple organizations like R&D, marketing, sales among others.
AEs are expected to manage multiple customer activities concurrently, and work with Sales and AE Management to set priorities.
/MSEE with 3+ years of experience working on advanced process node flows.
Formal Verification experience is optional.
Working knowledge of scripting languages like Unix, Perl and TCL.
Customer sensitivity and the ability to multiplex issues & set priorities are essential for success in the position.
Strong verbal and written communication skills are mandatory.
Some travel may be required.

Austin, TX or Marlborough, MA

Job Details
Salesforce is looking for a strong front end developer to join Team Trailhead to focus on  myTrailhead  .
Learn  more how myTrailhead  connects  communities on our website here
, may be even  earn  a couple badges on there and show it off on your profile!
We are assembling a team that will focus on the myTrailhead customers requirements.
Our current tech stack is Ruby on Rails, Node.js, jQuery and React deployed on Heroku.
You will lead the frontend features' design and execution on this team.
Trailhead is a distributed team and we work in a collaborative environment.
We value transparent communication and feedback, code reviews, and making learning fun.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with technical architect and peers to design and document new features for myTrailhead customers.
Drive the innovative design solutions and choice of technology and tools to build efficient and consistent features.
Build features by writing maintainable code and know when to apply unit, functional, and integration tests.
Collaborate with engineering manager, product manager and the UX team to understand customer requirements, product backlog, technical debt, dependencies.
Guide and mentor engineering staff through code reviews and pairing.
Minimum Qualifications:
Several years experience with object oriented programming.
Professional experience with Javascript, Node.js, React.
Strong technical design and abstraction skills.
You write technical designs/test plans and test content for your area and act as technical reviewer for others.
You are a strong communicator who is proactive and can explain complex technical concepts simply to a diverse set of audiences.
Consistent track record of delivering on commitments.

Job Description:
DELTA Resources is seeking a Junior Software developer to join our Cloud,Cyber, and Data Analytics team at our Corporate Headquarters office in Alexandria, VA.
This is an entry-level to junior position in DoD cloud computing/DevSecOps that offers outstanding opportunities for learning and career advancement.
Ideal candidates will have strong technical aptitude, hands on programming capability, curiosity, and desire to build cool innovative tools while working as part of an Agile Scrum team.
This position involves work in a mixed Windows/Linux/AWS Cloud environment supporting DoD Level 5/Level 2 cloud architectures.
Primary Responsibilities:
Develop, convert, and migrate applications from legacy platforms using a variety of programming languages.
Collaborate to design, code, test, and validate applications following CMMI Level 3 practices
Support the team with all other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or combination of coursework and work experience in tech related field.
Ability to obtain a DoD Secret security clearance.
Excellent problem solving skills.
Solid HTML, CSS, and
JavaScript skills with 4 or 3GL programming experience and demonstrated programming skills in a current scripting language - (for example)
Angular, Python, Perl, Ruby, Go, JQuery, Node.JS.
Preferred Skills:
Working knowledge of Linux and facility with command line.
Math, statistics, or analytics a strong plus.
Familiarity with modern DevOps principles, methods, and tools a plus.
Understanding of modern JavaScript applications and web pages, Single Page Web applications, Micro-services, and Containerization are all pluses.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in developing technical strategy, and architecting large front-end solutions. 0
-4 years experience of software development and deployment of distributed multi-tier applications across web, mobile-web and apps.
Front-End technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, templating languages, view
frameworks [e.g., Angular.js] etc.
This opportunity is for a Front End Engineer I who will serve as a Front End developer for Audible's Consumer Domains group.
We are the home for tech talent that wants to grow Audible's market leading business and build the sites and services (APIs) across desktop and mobile devices.
The team is comprised of developers who work in an agile environment and partner closely with Audible and Amazon tech teams, Product, UX and QA teams.
We are embarking on a mission to reshape the fundamental experiences and delight our customers and drive a strong engineering culture.
It's our responsibility to push Audible into new places; wherever our customers are listening.
Achieving this vision means expanding and strengthening our development process and leveraging new technologies to deliver services and web applications.
We need your help to develop and deliver on this vision.
Success means we lay the foundation for continued expansion of our company without disrupting an already tremendously successful and much loved project.
HOW DOES AMAZON FIT IN?
We're a part of Amazon: they are our parent company and it's a great partnership.
Audible is built on a strong foundation of Amazon technology and you'll have insight into the inner workings of the world's leading ecommerce experience.
There's a LOT to learn!
Your career will benefit from working with teams like Search, A9, Kindle, P13N, Alexa and many more.
Adopt best practices in software engineering: design, testing, version control, documentation, build, deployment, and operations.
Design and implement key initiatives and major features from the front end client down through the underlying services powering it.
Participate in the full development life cycle, working within broadly defined parameters.
Constantly strive to raise the bar on front-end engineering excellence and working to ensure high performance of our sites and accessibility of our content.
Lead the way - staying up to date with tools, trends, technologies and frameworks both industry-wide and within Amazon and then sharing that knowledge in a meaningful way with the community.
Outstanding interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively across teams & multiple division stakeholders.
Proven success in mentoring tech leads and engineers.
History of delivering customer-driven software products at a high scale in a fast paced, technology first, rapid-growth company.
Prior success as a strategic influencer on the direction of product design and development.
Outstanding interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively across teams & multiple division stakeholders.
Output is seeking a Jr. Web Developer to join the Web Development Team to play an active role in the creation, execution, management and maintenance of Output's various web properties and services.
The Jr. Web Developer will work closely with nearly every department including marketing, product, operations, and design, ensuring each department's needs are met on Output.com.
Responsibilities
Build one-off web pages in WordPress.
Work alongside the design team to build and edit web pages.
Work alongside the marketing team to edit and consult on web-related work.
Work with web development to plan and execute revisions to the company's sites.
Ensure company site is fully functional at all times and quickly fix issues.
Requirements
Experience with WordPress themes, plugins, and WooCommerce.
Experience in building functional front-facing webpages, with a keen eye for design/details and SEO best practices.
Experience reading design documents (PSD, Zeplin, Sketch, etc.) and extracting assets.
Proficiency with front-end coding and debugging.
Understands and applies principles of page optimization, such as media queries, asynchronous loading, and caching.
Strong understanding of ES6, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3, AJAX, CSS frameworks (eg Bootstrap), version control (Git/Github).
Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Flywheel is looking for a design-minded software engineer with front-end development experience to join our rapidly growing development team.
This job will include a lot of front-end development (JavaScript, CSS) and some back-end development (Ruby).
You'll be responsible for developing all aspects of the Flywheel software stack but you will mainly focus on ensuring our software is beautiful and easy to use.
You will work with our design and engineering teams to maintain almost-flawless functionality, and add brilliant, brand new features.
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build.
To design.
To consult.
To think along with clients and sell.
To make markets.
To collaborate.
Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible.
Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems?
If so, lets talk.
Your Role and Responsibilities
This is a unique and exciting opportunity within IBM's Garage Method & Architecture Center web development team.
As a key member of this content squad, you will use your editorial, content development, video, and content production expertise to grow the engagement and views of the site.
IBM Garage Method and Cloud Architecture sites are key to communicating IBM's POV to a technical audience.
We're seeking a digital content and video developer who will work across the content squad as a writer and video script and production expert.
You will work with a variety of stakeholders across IBM and use their talent to help IBM in its goal to grow enterprise mindshare through our digital presence.
You will work with our stakeholders, our infrastructure squad, and our content squad and leadership to help produce content and deliver to the site.
Create value content for Garage Method & Cloud Architecture sites
Produce engaging content that encourages further exploration
Keep current on industry trends across subject areas, working with acquisition editors to spot trends and ensure we provide coverage for them.
Function as a core member of a high-performing, agile team using tools like Git, markdown, HTML, JavaScript, Video production tools, Visual design tools like Sketch, Photoshop, etc.
Technical communication (technical content development) 1 year
Video scripting and creation 1 year
Visual design 1 year
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Web development (html, markdown, javascript) 1 year
Interview skills
About Business Unit
IBM Cloud provides the security, control, and visibility that our clients have come to expect.
We are working to provide the right tools and environment to combine all of our client's data, no matter where it resides, to respond to changing market dynamics.
What matters to you when you're looking for your next career challenge?
Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world?
What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities - where you can truly discover your passion?
What about all of these?
If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge.
Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.
Impact.
Inclusion.
Infinite Experiences.
Do your best work ever.
We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action.
IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
In this position, you will become a member of a small development team providing quality software solutions to DoD customers.
You must be eligible to obtain a DOD Security clearance, which requires a US citizen.
We develop software to support management of our nation's DoD installations.
What you will do...
Apply and grow your expertise and experience in full life-cycle support while designing developing, documenting, testing, and deploying business management applications
Work in small to medium size teams to develop on-line applications that are deployed in a cloud environment to users across the world
Adhere to sound software development processes and participate in an agile environment where high quality delivery is an expectation
Work with government stakeholders to design, develop, integrate, and test solutions for business requirements
Use development tools to track your tasks, manage code changes, and document your work
Have access to on-line training to further your knowledge in technology
You would be a great fit if you have...
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or other related technical field with 2+ years of relevant experience
2+ years of experience with SQL, JavaScript, HTML, CSS
2+ years developing new software and/or troubleshooting and enhancing existing software
Experience with object-oriented concepts and programming
Experience with web development frameworks, database technologies, web services, web application servers
It would be even better if you have...
Experience with Ext JS framework, Rest, XML, JSON
Experience with server page technologies such as PHP, ASP, JSP, ColdFusion
Experience with Atlassian tools such as Jira, and Confluence
Experience with configuration management, automated build and continuous integration tools such as SVN, ANT, Jenkins
Experience with automated testing tools such as Selenium, JUnit, Katalon
Ability to solve problems while adapting and learning new technologies and concepts
Ability to perform as a positive, self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, and responsible team-player
Strong written and oral communication skills
This position requires the candidate to be able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance.
What you'll get...
An immediately-vested 401(K) with employer matching
Rapid PTO accrual schedule with floating holidays
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
Tuition assistance, financing, and refinancing
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Company-paid infertility treatments

Koddi is looking for a Front End Web Developer with a knack for communication and an eye for design to join our growing engineering team.

As a Front End Developer, you will apply the principles and techniques of user experience to develop actionable designs to meet the desired functionality of our stakeholders and integrate these designs into our development process.
Who you are
Experience designing REST endpoints
Develop a world-class UI ensuring alignment between web design and UX requirements
You have experience with modern JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular or Vue
You have a deep understanding of SPA (single page application) architecture of the website
You have a strong ability to translate requirements into software
You have competence with logical and technical problem solving
You are committed to quality and thoroughness
You're organized and manage your time well
You have a passion for learning new technologies
What you'll do...
Take an existing application architecture and use best practices to create UI to product specifications
You are a strong advocate for User Experience and back it up with effective execution

You will create and maintain frontend style guide including the site organization, page layout, navigation, style sheets, graphical elements, fonts, color palette, frontend application folder structure, and coding conventions
You'll evaluate new or best architecture practices
You'll create mockups and wireframes from project requirements
You will ensure designs are consistent across browsers and device types
You will analyze and execute user experience improvement through qualitative methods
You'll collaborate with the product team and product managers to improve existing functionality and bring new ideas to life
You'll assist with interviewing, on-boarding, and training frontend engineers as they join the team
Who we are
Forging a better path for travelers through integrity, insights, inclusivity, and innovation.
Getting the experience right, together.
Koddi is a cloud provider of marketing technology for travel brands.
Our partners leverage the Koddi platform and its fully automated and customizable reporting features to manage marketing investment for hundreds of thousands of hotel properties globally.

The position will report to the technical lead, but will frequently engage with other members of the development/QA staff, as well as with product and UX teams, to help scope, design, and estimate features and enhancements being considered for prioritization.

Neat is a company with a rich history in innovation.

Headquartered in Philadelphia, PA, Neat began as an expense tracking software app for individuals and small business and later expanded to include personal scanners for document organization and management.
Neat grew to be one of the top providers of integrated scanner/organizational software in the US.
Neat has recently began the process of divesting its hardware side of the business to allow it to focus solely on SaaS software.
We behave like a startup culture, with strong financial backing and seasoned leadership and investment partners.
We commit to providing an environment where you can grow, lead and develop your skills with a market leader...
and we like to have fun with great perks and frequent company outings and events.
careers@neat.com

Description
Prudential Workplace Solutions Group (WSG)
technology team is looking to hire a hands-on developer to advance our architectural strategies and innovation efforts.
Ideal candidate is someone who is tech-savvy, passionate to learn and adopt new technologies, understands web development technology stack, emerging web standards and able to turn concepts to life.
The selected individual will be part of talented engineering team working in a fast-paced and outcome focused environment.
Responsibilities:
Development of cloud native applications and services
Development of micro-frontends and standalone web components
Deliver high-quality testable code with attention to details
Identify, analyze, debug and tune application performance
Conduct code reviews for system modifications and development
Decoupling existing features from monolithic platform to micro-services
Qualifications
Associate / bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Applied Mathematics with a GPA >= 3.3
Strong object-oriented, functional and procedural design skills coupled with a deep knowledge of data structures and algorithms
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, debugging and critical thinking skills
Working knowledge of Linux / Unix is preferred
Experience with web frameworks and W3C standards is a plus
Demonstrable experience in application development is a plus
Able to craft multi-functional requirements and translate them into practical engineering tasks
Ability to work in a fast paced, team-based environment
Strong verbal and written communication skills and social skills
Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America.
The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time.
Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.
We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the quality and skills of our diverse associates.
We are proud to be a place where talented people who want to make a difference can grow as professionals, leaders, and as individuals.
Visit www.prudential.com to learn more about our values, our history and our brand.
Prudential is an equal opportunity employer.
Search firms or agencies should email Staffing at staffingagencies@prudential.com for more information about doing business with Prudential.

The Web Developer is responsible for the design, implementation and/or installation of designated web software, forms and other web projects, as well as support operations for the web infrastructure.

These applications need to utilize current web standards and best practices

An ability to convert graphic layouts and content from Adobe Photoshop and/or Illustrator into fully functional websites with pixel perfect accuracy
An eye for detail, strong grasp of web standards, usability standards, technology trends, SEO/SEM principles, device portability and browser compatibility
Must work well within a multidisciplinary team, capable of processing multiple projects simultaneously, rapidly - sometimes on a moment's notice
Can assist the institution and its various departments as a subject matter expert, trainer, and troubleshooter for all things related to the web

Must be able to work outside the normal working schedule when needed
Required Experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent education/experience
Minimum 1-3 years of web development including database management and ecommerce

Develop and implement solutions that are fully integrated with Information Technology standards and demonstrate standard methodologies Lead the technical aspect of the front and back end delivery for multiple projects, setting technical direction, while delivering quality results Build and maintain positive relationships with extended functional teams Investigate, evangelize, and implement the latest web technologies across the learning organization

Winchester, VA

About Cognizant Cognizant (Nasdaq-100:  CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era.
Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses.
Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 193 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world.
Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

When you join Dynamo, you don't just become another number, you become part of a family.
A family who thrives to keep morale high and opportunities endless.

Job Description:
Work with a dynamic development on building beautiful and responsive applications in React / HTML5 / CSS3.
Create responsive, mobile-ready pages as well as rich and dynamic content.
Write functional requirement documents and specifications.
Provide enhancements and maintenance of websites/portals.
Assist back-end developers with coding and troubleshooting.
Maintain graphic standards and branding throughout the product's interface.
Remain up-to-date on emerging technologies.
Promote usability best practices.
Required   Qualifications

Required Skillset: 2 - 5 years of relevant experience with advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks Proficiency in React, Angular, or Vue (React-preferred) Comfortable with HTML5, CSS3 (SASS), and modern UI frameworks (Bootstrap, Material, etc.)
Strong understanding of object-oriented data models Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences Possession of excellent analytical skills
What We Offer You:
An engaging, familial culture centered around personal and team development  100% paid medical benefits
401K with company match

Primary Location: Mclean, VA
Dynamo has extensive experience successfully servicing numerous US federal agencies and commercial customers.

Our experienced leadership team combined with the quality and caliber of our data scientists, software engineers, technologists and program management professionals sets us apart from the competition.
With over twenty-five different websites and each with a unique focus of product offerings and services, we have been successful in positioning ourselves at the top of all search results.
Our online store, America's Fence Store, has a fast-growing e-commerce platform in Shopify, making us one of the largest resellers of fence materials online.
As much as we recognize our success; we also recognize our need to continue to develop these sites.
We have a considerable appetite for improvements, re-design and new sites.
The Web Developer is a target specific position working in cooperation with our marketing team and company leadership.
This new position will be responsible for the design, creation, and modification of web sites.
This position will analyze search engine data and establish an on-going plan of further growth and refinement.
The web developer will work closely with outside SEO contractors and web development consultants to execute web site content, graphics, performance, and capacity.
This is an exciting position for an individual who wants to spread their wings in seeing how far and deep they can impact ecommerce and website SEO.
Having a national customer base for the resale of goods and custom manufactured goods.
You are working with a team and company that are heavily vested in continued growth.
You are encouraged to find new, fresh and out-of-the box approaches.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Strong operating knowledge of WordPress, Shopify and related website development tools
HTML, CSS and Javascript coding expertise
Capacity to utilize Google analytics and SEO tools
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Technically proficient with experience using a variety of software tools
Performance Responsibilities
Design, build, or maintain web sites, using authoring or scripting languages, content creation tools, management tools, and digital media.
Perform or direct web site updates.
Write, design, or edit web page content, or direct others producing content.
Back up files from web sites to local directories for instant recovery in case of problems.
Evaluate code to ensure that it is valid, is properly structured, meets industry standards and is compatible with browsers, devices, or operating systems.
Maintain understanding of current web technologies or programming practices through continuing education, reading, or participation in professional conferences, workshops, or groups.
Develop or validate test routines and schedules to ensure that test cases mimic external interfaces and address all browser and device types.
Renew domain name registrations.
Write supporting code for web applications or web sites.
Perform web site tests according to planned schedules, or after any web site or product revisions.
Develop and document style guidelines for web site content.
Identify or maintain links to and from other web sites and check links to ensure proper functioning.
Create searchable indices for web page content.
Register web sites with search engines to increase web site traffic.

Provide clear, detailed descriptions of web site specifications such as product features, activities, software, communication protocols, programming languages, and operating systems software and hardware.
